trans-unit.source: How to: Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: How to: Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider
trans-unit.target: How to: Configure AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider

trans-unit.source: Applies To
trans-unit.target: Applies To

trans-unit.source: Active Directory® Federation Services 2.0
trans-unit.target: Active Directory® Federation Services 2.0

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: This How To describes how to configure <token>firstref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: This How To describes how to configure <token>firstref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Configuring <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as identity provider for your ASP.NET web application will allow your users to authenticate to your ASP.NET web application by logging on to their corporate account managed by Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Configuring <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as identity provider for your ASP.NET web application will allow your users to authenticate to your ASP.NET web application by logging on to their corporate account managed by Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Contents
trans-unit.target: Contents

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Add AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider in the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Add AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider in the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Add a Certificate to ACS for Decrypting Tokens Received from AD FS 2.0 in the ACS Management Portal (Optional)
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Add a Certificate to ACS for Decrypting Tokens Received from AD FS 2.0 in the ACS Management Portal (Optional)

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Add Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a Relying Party in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Add Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a Relying Party in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: Step 4 - Add Claim Rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: Step 4 - Add Claim Rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: Objectives
trans-unit.target: Objectives

trans-unit.source: Configuring trust between <token>secondref_acs</token> and <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Configuring trust between <token>secondref_acs</token> and <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Improving security of token and metadata exchange.
trans-unit.target: Improving security of token and metadata exchange.

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Configuring <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as the identity provider enables reusing existing accounts managed by corporate Active Directory for authentication.
trans-unit.target: Configuring <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as the identity provider enables reusing existing accounts managed by corporate Active Directory for authentication.

trans-unit.source: It eliminates the need for either building complex account synchronization mechanisms or developing custom code that performs the tasks of accepting end user credentials, validating them against the credentials store, and managing the identities.
trans-unit.target: It eliminates the need for either building complex account synchronization mechanisms or developing custom code that performs the tasks of accepting end user credentials, validating them against the credentials store, and managing the identities.

trans-unit.source: Integrating <token>secondref_acs</token> and <token>secondref_adfs2</token> is accomplished by configuration only—no custom code is needed.
trans-unit.target: Integrating <token>secondref_acs</token> and <token>secondref_adfs2</token> is accomplished by configuration only—no custom code is needed.

trans-unit.source: Summary of Steps
trans-unit.target: Summary of Steps

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Add AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider in the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Add AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider in the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Add a Certificate to ACS for Decrypting Tokens Received From AD FS 2.0 in the ACS Management Portal (Optional)
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Add a Certificate to ACS for Decrypting Tokens Received From AD FS 2.0 in the ACS Management Portal (Optional)

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Add Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a Relying Party in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Add Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a Relying Party in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: Step 4 - Add Claim Rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: Step 4 - Add Claim Rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: Step 1 - Add AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider in the ACS Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Step 1 - Add AD FS 2.0 as an Identity Provider in the ACS Management Portal

trans-unit.source: This step adds <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This step adds <token>secondref_adfs2</token> as an identity provider in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: To add AD FS 2.0 as an identity provider in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>
trans-unit.target: To add AD FS 2.0 as an identity provider in the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal main page, click <ui>Identity Providers.</ui>
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal main page, click <ui>Identity Providers.</ui>

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add Identity Provider</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add Identity Provider</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Next to <ui>Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services 2.0</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Next to <ui>Microsoft Active Directory Federation Services 2.0</ui>, click <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Display name</ui> field, enter a display name for this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Display name</ui> field, enter a display name for this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Note that this name will appear both in the ACS Management Portal and by default on the login pages for your applications.
trans-unit.target: Note that this name will appear both in the ACS Management Portal and by default on the login pages for your applications.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>WS-Federation metadata</ui> field, enter the URL to the metadata document for your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> instance, or use the <ui>File</ui> option to upload a local copy of the metadata document.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>WS-Federation metadata</ui> field, enter the URL to the metadata document for your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> instance, or use the <ui>File</ui> option to upload a local copy of the metadata document.

trans-unit.source: When using a URL, the URL path to the metadata document can be found in the <ui>Service\Endpoints</ui> section of the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> Management Console.
trans-unit.target: When using a URL, the URL path to the metadata document can be found in the <ui>Service\Endpoints</ui> section of the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> Management Console.

trans-unit.source: The next two steps deal with login page options for your relying party applications; they are optional and can be skipped.
trans-unit.target: The next two steps deal with login page options for your relying party applications; they are optional and can be skipped.

trans-unit.source: If you want to edit the text that is displayed for this identity provider on the login pages for your applications, enter the desired text in the <ui>Login link text</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: If you want to edit the text that is displayed for this identity provider on the login pages for your applications, enter the desired text in the <ui>Login link text</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: If you want to display an image for this identity provider on the login pages for your applications, enter a URL to an image file in the <ui>Image URL</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: If you want to display an image for this identity provider on the login pages for your applications, enter a URL to an image file in the <ui>Image URL</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: Ideally, this image file should be hosted at a trusted site (using HTTPS, if possible, to prevent browser security warnings), and you should have permission from your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> partner to display this image.
trans-unit.target: Ideally, this image file should be hosted at a trusted site (using HTTPS, if possible, to prevent browser security warnings), and you should have permission from your <token>secondref_adfs2</token> partner to display this image.

trans-unit.source: See help on <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link> for additional guidance on login page settings.
trans-unit.target: See help on <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link> for additional guidance on login page settings.

trans-unit.source: If you want to prompt users to log on using their email address instead of clicking a link, then enter the email domain suffixes that you want to associate with this identity provider in the <ui>Email domain name(s)</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: If you want to prompt users to log on using their email address instead of clicking a link, then enter the email domain suffixes that you want to associate with this identity provider in the <ui>Email domain name(s)</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the identity provider hosts user accounts whose email addresses end with @contoso.com, then enter contoso.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the identity provider hosts user accounts whose email addresses end with @contoso.com, then enter contoso.com.

trans-unit.source: Use semicolons to separate the list of suffixes (for example, contoso.com; fabrikam.com).
trans-unit.target: Use semicolons to separate the list of suffixes (for example, contoso.com; fabrikam.com).

trans-unit.source: See help on <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link> for additional guidance on login page settings.
trans-unit.target: See help on <link xlink:href="e23d5f14-f36b-478a-935d-b753fa0cf4d0" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Login Pages</link> for additional guidance on login page settings.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Relying party applications</ui> field, select any existing relying party applications that you want to associate with this identity provider.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Relying party applications</ui> field, select any existing relying party applications that you want to associate with this identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This causes the identity provider to appear on the login page for that application and it enables claims to be delivered from the identity provider to the application.
trans-unit.target: This causes the identity provider to appear on the login page for that application and it enables claims to be delivered from the identity provider to the application.

trans-unit.source: Note that rules still need to be added to the application's rule group that define which claims to deliver.
trans-unit.target: Note that rules still need to be added to the application's rule group that define which claims to deliver.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 - Add a Certificate to ACS for Decrypting Tokens Received From AD FS 2.0 in the ACS Management Portal (Optional)
trans-unit.target: Step 2 - Add a Certificate to ACS for Decrypting Tokens Received From AD FS 2.0 in the ACS Management Portal (Optional)

trans-unit.source: This step adds and configures a certificate for decrypting tokens that are received from <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This step adds and configures a certificate for decrypting tokens that are received from <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This is an optional step that helps in strengthening security.
trans-unit.target: This is an optional step that helps in strengthening security.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, it helps in protecting the token’s contents from being viewed and tampered with.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, it helps in protecting the token’s contents from being viewed and tampered with.

trans-unit.source: To add a certificate to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for decrypting tokens received from AD FS 2.0 (optional)
trans-unit.target: To add a certificate to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> for decrypting tokens received from AD FS 2.0 (optional)

trans-unit.source: If you were not authenticated using <token>ms_acct</token>, you will be required to do so.
trans-unit.target: If you were not authenticated using <token>ms_acct</token>, you will be required to do so.

trans-unit.source: After being authenticated with your <token>ms_acct</token>, you are redirected to the <ui>My Projects</ui> page on the <token>azure_1</token> portal.
trans-unit.target: After being authenticated with your <token>ms_acct</token>, you are redirected to the <ui>My Projects</ui> page on the <token>azure_1</token> portal.

trans-unit.source: Click the desired project name on the <ui>My Project</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: Click the desired project name on the <ui>My Project</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Project:<<your project name>></ui> page, click the <ui>Access Control</ui> link next to the desired namespace.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Project:<<your project name>></ui> page, click the <ui>Access Control</ui> link next to the desired namespace.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Access Control Settings: <<your namespace>></ui> page, click the <ui>Manage Access Control</ui> link.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Access Control Settings: <<your namespace>></ui> page, click the <ui>Manage Access Control</ui> link.

trans-unit.source: On the ACS Management Portal main page, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the ACS Management Portal main page, click <ui>Certificates and Keys</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Add Token Decryption Certificate</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Add Token Decryption Certificate</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter a display name for the certificate.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Name</ui> field, enter a display name for the certificate.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Certificate</ui> field, browse for the X.509 certificate with a private key (.pfx file) for this <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, and then enter the password for the .pfx file in the <ui>Password</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Certificate</ui> field, browse for the X.509 certificate with a private key (.pfx file) for this <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, and then enter the password for the .pfx file in the <ui>Password</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: If you do not have a certificate, then follow the on-screen instructions to generate one, or see help on <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link> for additional guidance on obtaining a certificate.
trans-unit.target: If you do not have a certificate, then follow the on-screen instructions to generate one, or see help on <link xlink:href="b75ed5c7-ca81-44a2-8d8d-6a63399f87dd" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Certificates and Keys</link> for additional guidance on obtaining a certificate.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Save</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Save</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 - Add Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a Relying Party in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: Step 3 - Add Your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a Relying Party in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: This step helps to configure <token>secondref_acs</token> as a relying party in <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This step helps to configure <token>secondref_acs</token> as a relying party in <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a relying party in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: To add the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> as a relying party in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: In the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> Management console, click <ui>AD FS 2.0</ui>, and then, in the <ui>Actions</ui> pane, click <ui>Add Relying Party Trust</ui> to start the Add Relying Party Trust Wizard.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> Management console, click <ui>AD FS 2.0</ui>, and then, in the <ui>Actions</ui> pane, click <ui>Add Relying Party Trust</ui> to start the Add Relying Party Trust Wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Welcome</ui> page, click <ui>Start</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Welcome</ui> page, click <ui>Start</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Data Source</ui> page, click <ui>Import data about the relying party published online or on a local network</ui>, type the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Data Source</ui> page, click <ui>Import data about the relying party published online or on a local network</ui>, type the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Specify Display Name</ui> page, enter a display name, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Specify Display Name</ui> page, enter a display name, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Choose Issuance Authorization Rules</ui> page, click <ui>Permit all users to access this Relying Party</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Choose Issuance Authorization Rules</ui> page, click <ui>Permit all users to access this Relying Party</ui>, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Ready to Add Trust</ui> page, review the relying party trust settings, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to save the configuration.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Ready to Add Trust</ui> page, review the relying party trust settings, and then click <ui>Next</ui> to save the configuration.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Finish</ui> page, click <ui>Close</ui> to exit the wizard.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Finish</ui> page, click <ui>Close</ui> to exit the wizard.

trans-unit.source: This also opens the <ui>Edit Claim Rules for WIF Sample App</ui> properties page.
trans-unit.target: This also opens the <ui>Edit Claim Rules for WIF Sample App</ui> properties page.

trans-unit.source: Leave this dialog box open, and then go to the next procedure.
trans-unit.target: Leave this dialog box open, and then go to the next procedure.

trans-unit.source: Step 4 - Add Claim Rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: Step 4 - Add Claim Rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: This step configures claims rules in <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.
trans-unit.target: This step configures claims rules in <token>secondref_adfs2</token>.

trans-unit.source: This way, you ensure that the desired claims are passed from <token>secondref_adfs2</token> to <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This way, you ensure that the desired claims are passed from <token>secondref_adfs2</token> to <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: To add claim rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0
trans-unit.target: To add claim rules for the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token> in AD FS 2.0

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Edit Claim Rules</ui> properties page, on the <ui>Issuance Transform Rules</ui> tab, click <ui>Add Rule</ui> to start the Add Transform Claim Rule Wizard.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Edit Claim Rules</ui> properties page, on the <ui>Issuance Transform Rules</ui> tab, click <ui>Add Rule</ui> to start the Add Transform Claim Rule Wizard.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Select Rule Template</ui> page, under <ui>Claim rule template</ui>, click <ui>Pass Through or Filter an Incoming Claim</ui> on the menu, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Select Rule Template</ui> page, under <ui>Claim rule template</ui>, click <ui>Pass Through or Filter an Incoming Claim</ui> on the menu, and then click <ui>Next</ui>.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Configure Rule</ui> page, in <ui>Claim rule name</ui>, type a display name for the rule.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Configure Rule</ui> page, in <ui>Claim rule name</ui>, type a display name for the rule.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Incoming claim type</ui> drop-down list, select the identity claim type you want to pass through to the application, and then click <ui>Finish</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Incoming claim type</ui> drop-down list, select the identity claim type you want to pass through to the application, and then click <ui>Finish</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>OK</ui> to close the property page and save the changes to the relying party trust.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>OK</ui> to close the property page and save the changes to the relying party trust.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 1-5 for each claim that you want to issue from <token>secondref_adfs2</token> to your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 1-5 for each claim that you want to issue from <token>secondref_adfs2</token> to your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>OK</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>OK</ui>.
